info.name: Heavy Cloak
info.description:
This style will make your Firefox as plain as possible!
It does the same thing as my other style (13527), only this time with the app itself. BTW, the effects on the page are from that style, try it out!
For better use, put all the buttons on the extension bar (yes, it is possible!)
info.additionalInfo:
The buttons, menu, bars, all that become grayed out or disappear altogether until hovered. For some stuff you'll have to edit the css (comment/uncomment) in order to show/hide (I'll try to be more specifc when I have the time).
I put all the buttons (back, forth, address, etc) on the extension bar, but you can put it in any bar you want (navigation, links, whatever). 
I recommend a set of extensions to further "planify" FF, as follows (all versions are the top ones as I write this, no need to keep track on it):

Autohide Tabbar 2.6.1 - pretty much what it says on the tin, but not as useful as you might think on this case. I set it to hide/unhide with a double ctrl pressing, see the diference on the pics (yes, that is not thanks to my style :-(
Download Statusbar 0.9.7.2 - very useful, replaces that clumsy download window, Mozilla should put it by default on FF
Hide Caption Titlebar Plus 2.1.6 - the final touch, removes the titlebar, only makes it a little bit difficult to move the window (I use the blank area on the tab bar or the stop button to move the window)
Personal Menu 5.0 - replaces the firefox button with one a lot smaller, and more important, one that I can hide with the extension :-)
Stylish 1.1 - Guess what?
